storyInfo: Learning her close friend has been executed, Jane is thoroughly shaken, and Outcast consoles her. Horn orders Bagpipe to find a Messenger to send word about Dublinn, and at the same time, she comes to learn of the stolen Originium goods' whereabouts.

attributes.content: I'm back. I found some bread and clean water. Craig's been running about most of the night, he needs to fill up his stomach...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Er, what's wrong with everyone? What... happened?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: It's her! She's the one who tipped the Victorian Army off... She killed Saoirse!
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: What... What are you talking about?!?!
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Saoirse... What happened to Saoirse?!
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You're asking? She's dead! You black-hearted Victorian soldier! You got close to her just so you could pluck intel from her own mouth, didn't you?
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: And now she's been executedâ€”are you happy?!
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: I never even thought...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: How could this...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I'm sorry... Saoirse...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Save your tears! You've no right to be sad for her! And you've no right... to be standing here!
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: I was sincere with her, always...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Sincere? A Victorian soldier, telling us Tarans sincerity?
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: What a joke for the ages!
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: Aren't we all... countrymen?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Countrymen? What do you know of our country?
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: Have you eaten the grains we eat, spoken the language we speak, felt the pain we feel?
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: But I've always wanted to help you...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Don't come any closer! Put down your flag! You're not calling for backup on us!
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: I don't want to... I wasn't...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Get out of our land! Never again will the home of the Tarans need Victoria's ensign!
attributes.name: Grieving Man

attributes.content: You want... me gone?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: We've got no choice.
attributes.name: Sorrowful Woman

attributes.content: You saw how... I never even did any wrong, and yet... none of you would just let me go...
attributes.name: Sorrowful Woman

attributes.content: I think... Ronan was right, we have a chance now. If we can just win, then nobody will ever come hassling me or Craig again... *sob*...
attributes.name: Sorrowful Woman

attributes.content: Craig... do you...?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: We don't need you!
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: A... stone?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.text: 'Have you seen the looks in their eyes before?'
'In their eyes, no matter how you behave...'

attributes.content: So it was... me who never figured it out.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I should go.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: The troops are retreating in defeat. Over half the blocks in this city will very soon fall into the spectre force's hands.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: How'd they break so quick?! I was thinkin', even if their organization and trainin' was rock-bottom level, at least they could hold out until tomorrow mornin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You noticed how that squad from the barracks behaved just now, didn't you?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I saw it. We were holdin' the stadium together, but then once the enemy came, they all ran for the rear in a flash. Would've been useless no matter how we held out.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: They seem to have completely lost their will to fight.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: That might be it. After all, it was a situation just now. The enemy shows up, the residents in refuge all cheer for 'em and open the gates in. Any soldier'd be a little deflated watchin' a scene like that.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: But Colonel Hamilton doesn't seem in any way like the kind who gives up this easily. He especially values County Hillock.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The barracks might be at a disadvantage right now, but they didn't seem to be in any chaos at all when they retreated. They still had firm organization.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I can only believe that this present state still falls into the Colonel's plans. He has some other intent in this war situation.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Closest forces are County Kevin's barracks. If we sent out the signal for help, they could get here by evenin' soonest.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Assuming they receive the signal in the first place.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Worried about problems with the comms system?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's our third day since coming here, and we still haven't received any news from Londinium. County Hillock is like a lone island at this moment.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No problem, just a few grenades and a wee squad of mixed forces. I'll sort it out. This street's still safe for the time bein'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Bagpipe... remember in training when you just joined us, I gave you two hours of weighted handstand push-ups as a punishment.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Course I'd never forget, Leader. Wasn't much of a bad punishment as far as I'm concerned, but for a while, I really thought you didn't like me too much.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I never told you why.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Actually, it was because you told me as you were reporting in, you'd stuffed mince pudding and blankets in your marching bag.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Eh? That's a hometown treat. It's good, honest.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You said much the same at the time.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: On the day of the solo cross-country test, you were already starving when you came back, and you obviously kept food in your bag, but you still wouldn't eat it.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Couldn't really bear to... I was goin' to have it as a reward for myself, once the trainin' was over. Scoff it down at the happiest moment.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I once maintained that a person too attached to her home, unable to surmount the past, could not become a good officer.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: So, though your grades at Royal Guard were exceptional, and Instructor Slim spared no effort in recommending you to me, I still had doubts as to your potential.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: So that's what it was! But you've been awful nice to me since.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You proved yourself.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I gradually came to understand. It's only because you have an indestructible attachment in you, that you could become who you are today, a most excellent Victorian soldier, someone to surpass me.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Bagpipe, what I say next, you need to listen wellâ€”
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We have to give up on this block. I'm about to take Cello's group to a comms base in the northeast corner. We're hoping it hasn't been occupied by the spectre force yet.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: And you, go immediately to the contact station, find a Messenger, and ensure you find them a way out of the city too.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: If there's already no way left, then make one.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Bagpipe, I order you. Shy at no cost. You have to relay out what's happened in County Hillock.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Dammit. The others are all with The Leader doing more meaningful things, and I get the rotten luck of sweeping up here...
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: Funny now that I think about it. There's fighting going on all over. Why would The Leader insist I sweep clean around the statue?
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: Huh? Who is it... What are you grabbing at me for?
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: Is this where... Saoirse died?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Saoirse? You mean the traitor The Leader executed? Yeah, it was all her fault. She's dead, and you want me here bloody sweeping up these ashes...
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: You mean, what you're sweeping is...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Rubbish, nothing more.
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: She... She was a good girl. To her family, to her friends... she was so warm. She gave... everything for this city.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Why? What... did she even do wrong? She teared up just reading romance novelsâ€”she'd never have it in her to harm anyone...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Wh... What in the world's wrong with you?
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: Do you sympathize with this traitor? Just who are you?!
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: She's not called 'traitor.' Her name is Saoirse.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: She shouldn't be lying here so alone. I'm taking her back home.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You've got a screw loose. I'm leaving.
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: What's happening over there?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Sir! There's someone strange, crouching there, going on and on about taking the traitor home! I think she might be an enemy as well, and a traitor too!!
attributes.name: Busy Youth

attributes.content: Alright, good on you for reporting.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Hey, who are you?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: (...Saoirse, maybe you were wrong, and so was I.)
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: (You used your life to protect these people, and they didn't even care that you did. And they welcomed the rioters, too. The way this city's turned out now, they're not that innocent at all.)
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Are you from the other side?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: The other side? I don't know anymoreâ€”which side I'm even stood on.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Don't move! Any more, and your skull isâ€”
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Dealt with yet another few.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Rabblesome dregs... hah, I'll take however many I can do in on the retreat.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Hey, Vouivre over there, have you seen more of them about?
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: (...Dregs.)
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: (Calling Saoirse rubbish. Of course they're dregs.)
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: They just went running that way.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: We'll head right overâ€”
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: It seemed as if I heard the residents' shrieks, and seemed too as if I'd heard nothing at all.
I only thought of bringing Saoirse away, but no matter how I tried to put the strength in my fingers, the ash would still slip and fall through the cracks.
Saoirse...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: A hand reached out to me.
Time to get clear out, Jane.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Here, lemon tea. Warm up.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: If you want to cry, just let it out.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: ...I can't get the tears out.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I can feel your anger. Do you hate them?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Perhaps...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You got those soldiers to grab a Taran who supports the riots. That make you feel any better?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Maybe, I hate myself even more.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: If... I didn't hand that slip over, Saoirse wouldn't have died, would she?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: But all I wanted was to stop a bigger conflict... I thought, so long as I stood up, I could change...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: We wouldn't call it fate if it always went how we wanted.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Jane, can I tell you a story?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Go on. I'll try to listen.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I'll keep it short.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Decades ago, when I was about your age... No, maybe a bit older, back when I worked for the Churchâ€”
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You don't seem a thing like those Laterano clerics.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Years and experience are pretty good at changing a person.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: They had me arbitrating a war. Who the sides were, or why they were fighting, that's not important anymore. The parties responsible for getting the ball rolling are probably all dust anyway.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I just remember, there was a city asking for my help. I told them to lay their weapons down, I was ready to be their go-between, and off I went for peace talks with a general from the side sieging the place.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: The people in the city really weren't up for it, with the whole 'surrendering to tyranny' thing, so I took some drastic measures to get them talking, but we still never came to an agreement, in the end.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I gave up hope and left, bringing with me just a few who were willing to quit fighting, but the second day after I left, the city was breached.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Pretty much everyone who stayed ended up dead.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I believe... a good chunk of them all thought, nearing death's door, I'd still come and protect them in the end. But I didn't.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Looking back, I guess I was on the other side. I was the sinister pretender who'd given them hope, gotten them massacred.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: But you're not!
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You sure? Who can say?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: After that, I renounced my appointment as a cardinal, and left Laterano.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: It sounds like you tried your best...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Really? What if I kept at it, tried harder to stop the massacre that was coming?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Then you probably couldn't save a single one.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Or maybe I shouldn't have gone there with unrealistic hopes in the first place. Maybe I should've walked up and put a bullet in the head of the brute about to butcher an entire city.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Wouldn't that... have other consequences?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: No one can tell you the consequences of opening fire before you do it.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: But still, are you telling me you'd stand by and watchâ€”just let evil happen over and over, and over again?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: ...I wouldn't.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You're right. No matter how I keep questioning myself... I don't regret it at all.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Bagpipe... I hope you can still make it.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Triangle?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You came in at the right time. I'm about to dash for a communications center, position not far from here. You don't have to enter the city, we'll rendezvous directly at the outskirtsâ€”
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: ...Leader.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: What happened to you?! You sound in awful shape! Were you wounded?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Hah... not a... big issue... ahah... forget it, it's a little big. But no need... to fuss about me.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: Leader, I don't have much time. We've definitely found what we were looking for.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: These Originium products were sent to the artillery battalion.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: Artillery battalion?! The barracks' one?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Yes, absolutely. We're in here right now.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: The barracks have already been breached by the spectre force?!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: To be honest, I don't know.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: Another thing you need to know. The Originium products we found had all gone through modification.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: What kind of modification?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I only came by a part of it. Their structures aren't whole, someone's taken out the parts with active Originium... Do you still remember the serial bombing case at Stockton?
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: The offending group created a huge amount of incompletely combusting bombs, and caused grave Originium dust pollution in the core district, in retaliation against the government.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Right... hah... you get what I mean.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: They have us surrounded... we're out of luck hiding...
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: And Snare? The others?!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Snare's... next to me. There's a bolt clean through her heart... she went without too much pain, fortunately. Bass and Mandolin are still in the warehouse. Sorry. I couldn't bring them...
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: You did all you could. You're a fine leader.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Am I, then...? Surely not as good as you, Leader.
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: These hostiles... they're bizarre. They use weapons just like ours. And on top of that, I can hear... familiar call-outs...
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: Just who... is our enemy?
attributes.name: Triangle

attributes.content: That's not important, Triangle. You all come back alive for me, you hear that? This is an order!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Hah... got it, Leader. I'll keep it in mind.
attributes.name: Triangle
